actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide that a blind or disabled child otherwise qualified may be eligible for SSI benefits even though not a resident of the United States, if such a child is accompanying a parent who is a member of the Armed Forces serving a tour of duty overseas.

summary.text: Amends title XVI (Supplemental Security Income) (SSI) of the Social Security Act to make the U.S. residency requirement for SSI eligibility inapplicable to a child who is a U.S. citizen residing with a parent who is working outside the United States.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide that a blind or disabled child otherwise qualified may be eligible for SSI benefits even though not a resident of the United States, if such a child is accompanying a parent who is a member of the Armed Forces serving a tour of duty overseas.
